channel.title: Comments on: how to make sure that the view will have the underlying table changes by using sp_refreshview
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Michael Swart
item.dc:creator: Michael Swart
item.description: Wow. I never realized this behavior. However, I'm happy to learn that synonyms still behave as expected.
item.content:encoded: Wow. I never realized this behavior. However, I’m happy to learn that synonyms still behave as expected.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: As long as the procs are documented.<br /> Imagine someone took away xp_fixeddrives or sp_MSForEachtable procs, how many people would get screwed by that?
item.content:encoded:
As long as the procs are documented.
Imagine someone took away xp_fixeddrives or sp_MSForEachtable procs, how many people would get screwed by that?

item.title: By: LNBruno
item.dc:creator: LNBruno
item.content:encoded:
Thank you, Denis. It’s true what they say about “use it or lose it!”

I’m talking about system procedures, of course….
